messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the JAX-RS (RESTEasy) with Netty as HTTP transport framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/v1/NodeOpsResources.java`, I found that `com.datastax.mgmtapi.resources.v1.NodeOpsResources` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v1/ops/node`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full HTTP request path:
- /api/v1/ops/node

Are all HTTP methods acceptable?
- No.

Per-method acceptability for the path "/api/v1/ops/node" (based strictly on the code shown):
- HEAD: No
- POST: No
- OPTIONS: No
- TRACE: No
- GET: No
- PUT: No
- DELETE: No
- PATCH: No

Explanation
- The resource class is annotated with @Path("/api/v1/ops/node"), so the resource root path is /api/v1/ops/node.
- There are no JAX-RS resource methods declared without an additional @Path on that class that would match the exact path /api/v1/ops/node. All declared resource methods target subpaths:
  - @POST @Path("/decommission") → POST /api/v1/ops/node/decommission (accepts query param ?force)
  - @POST @Path("/rebuild") → POST /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild (accepts query param ?src_dc)
  - @GET @Path("/schema/versions") → GET /api/v1/ops/node/schema/versions
- Because there is no method annotated for the exact class-level path, none of the HTTP methods (HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS, TRACE) are accepted on /api/v1/ops/node according to the code. (If you intended to know allowed methods on the subpaths, see the three mappings above.)
